subject: Polo
Horses
lead_paragraph: While the necropsies on the 21 polo horses that died this week continued, the Florida authorities opened a criminal probe to determine whether the deaths were intentional, a result of negligence or simply a terrible accident. State officials have said they believe the horses died from an adverse drug reaction, toxins in their food or supplements, or some combination. Two days after the horses’ deaths, the authorities said they had not uncovered any crime but would continue to investigate. The necropsies were completed Tuesday and revealed some bleeding but offered no definitive clues. The veterinary investigators said the results from the testing of blood and tissue for toxins would be more important in pinpointing a cause of death, but those could take weeks.
